medical_history.chief_complaint: Psychiatric symptoms including syphilophobia, delusions, and social withdrawal.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient admitted on July 21, 1960, with a 1-year history of symptoms including delusions of infecting his wife and children, burning sensation in the genitals, bizarre suicidal attempts, disordered body image, and social withdrawal. Symptoms began about 2 years prior when he developed hip pain and abdominal discomfort. Over time, he became economically dependent on his wife and mental symptoms progressed.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Gaucher's disease diagnosed via bone marrow biopsy and splenectomy. Developed osteomyelitis of the right femur and pathological fracture of the left hip.
medical_history.family_history: An older sister had been afflicted with Gaucherâ€™s disease.
